alert.note: Alert for Frederick; Montgomery; Washington (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 25 at 1:55PM EDT until September 25 at 2:30PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN WASHINGTON COUNTY IN NORTH CENTRAL MARYLAND... NORTHWESTERN MONTGOMERY COUNTY IN CENTRAL MARYLAND...SOUTHWESTERN FREDERICK COUNTY IN NORTH CENTRAL MARYLAND...LOUDOUN COUNTY IN NORTHERN VIRGINIA...EASTERN CLARKE COUNTY IN NORTHWESTERN VIRGINIA... JEFFERSON AND SOUTHERN BERKELEY COUNTIES IN THE PANHANDLE OF WEST VIRGINIA... At 154 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Ranson to near Charles Town to 7 miles southwest of Bluemont, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Germantown, Leesburg, Broadlands, Lansdowne, Lowes Island, Charles Town, Poolesville, Ashburn, Ballenger Creek, Countryside, Purcellville, Brunswick, Ranson, Berryville, Round Hill, Harpers Ferry, Corporation Of Ranson, Boyds, Point Of Rocks and Bluemont. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
